name: ammonium nitrate phosphate production | ammonium nitrate phosphate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22977/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of ammonium nitrate phosphate (ANP) with 22% N and 22% P2O5 from ammonia and rock phosphate. ANP is a compound fertiliser used to enrich the soil in nitrogen (N) and phosphorous (P), two of the main macronutrients needed to support plant growth.;The production of ammonium nitrate phosphate involves the combination of liquid ammonia with nitric acid and rock phosphate, using heat and electricity. Production and waste treatment of catalysts, coating and packaging of the final fertiliser product are excluded. Infrastructure is included by means of a proxy module.;The main data sources for this dataset are Patyk and Reinhardt (1997) and Althaus et al (2007).;References:;Patyk A. and Reinhardt G. (1997) Düngemittel - Energie- und Strombilanzen. Vieweg Verlag. Braunschweig/Wiesbaden.;Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

The activity includes all the raw and processed materials necessary to produce this product. Liquid ammonia, nitric acid, rock phosphate, heat (as natural gas) and electricity are included. Direct emissions include ammonia, nitrogen oxides and particulate matter to air and heavy metals to water.

The activity ends with the final product being ready for transportation at the production site.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Primary data were collected on fertiliser production for the year 2013-2014. These data were based on annual average data based on different production plants.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The dataset is representative of ANP production in North America, adapted from data collected in European fertiliser plants.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This datasets corresponds to the technology used in North American fertiliser plants. The production of ammonium nitrate phosphate involves the combination of liquid ammonia with nitric acid and rock phosphate, using heat and electricity.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data were extrapolated from respective data for the geography of Europe, i.e.  production of ammonia and nitric acid are adapted to reflect production in North America.

exchanges.description: Estimation, based on various data sources (Althaus et al. 2007, Patyk and Reinhardt 1997).
